qas.question: When did Samo become the ruler of the first known Slav state?
What Frankish merchant was the ruler of the first Slav state in Central Europe?
What is the oldest Slav state in Central Europe?
When was the first Bulgarian Empire founded?
Bulgaria was instrumental in the spread of what to the rest of the Slavic world?
What outlived the first Slav ruler?
Where was the first known Avar state?
What became the official language of an empire in 681?

context: In <a0_0>the 7th century<a0_0/>, the Frankish merchant <a1_0><b5_0>Samo<b5_0/><a1_0/>, who supported the Slavs fighting their Avar rulers, became the ruler of <b6_0>the first known Slav state<b6_0/> in <b7_0>Central Europe<b7_0/>, which, however, most probably did not outlive its founder and ruler. This provided the foundation for subsequent Slavic states to arise on the former territory of this realm with <a2_0>Carantania<a2_0/> being the oldest of them. Very old also are the Principality of Nitra and the Moravian principality (see under Great Moravia). In this period, there existed central Slavic groups and states such as the Balaton Principality, but the subsequent expansion of the Magyars, as well as the Germanisation of Austria, separated the northern and southern Slavs. The First Bulgarian Empire was founded in <a3_0><b9_0>681<b9_0/><a3_0/>, the Slavic language <b8_0>Old Bulgarian<b8_0/> became the main and official of the empire in 864. Bulgaria was instrumental in the spread of <a4_0>Slavic literacy and Christianity<a4_0/> to the rest of the Slavic world.
